Movie about two Australian girls--Debbie (Nell Schofield) and Sue (Sue Knight)--and what happens when they become girlfriends of two surfer dudes from Broken Bay in New South Wales.

I could sense that the people working behind the production did not try to go out of their way and make millions. It felt like an honest-to-goodness underdog-budget experience that benefited because everything went as smoothly as possible with no major issues. I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was remade as the 1979 American classic "Stardust Memories", Woody Allen's homage to this wonderful film.
